criteria: Use of Commas, Parentheses, and Dashes
descriptions: No attempt to use commas, parentheses, or dashes is made.
Incorrect or inconsistent use of commas, parentheses, and dashes.
Attempts to use commas, parentheses, and dashes, but with frequent errors that confuse the meaning.
Generally correct use of commas, parentheses, and dashes, with occasional errors.
Consistent and correct use of commas, parentheses, and dashes to set off nonrestrictive/parenthetical elements, enhancing clarity.
Masterful use of commas, parentheses, and dashes to effectively set off nonrestrictive/parenthetical elements, adding sophistication to the writing.
Pervasive spelling errors make the writing difficult to understand.
Numerous spelling errors distract the reader.
Frequent spelling errors impede understanding in several places.
Occasional spelling errors do not significantly impede understanding.
Very few spelling errors are present.
